ray.misc

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.misc.Color

  • public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a simple RGB color. The similarities between it and the Vector3 class are enough to warrant abstraction in a more complicated system, but for simplicity we've kept it separate. There is also a Color class in the java.awt package, but again, we wanted simplicity and full access to the code.
    Author:
    ags

    • Constructor Detail

      • Color

        public Color()
        Default constructor. It passes reasonable values along to the explicit constructor.

      • Color

        public Color(Color newColor)
        Copy constructor. This constructor simply calls the explicit constructor with the necessary fields from the input as parameters.
        Parameters:
        newColor - The color to copy.

      • Color

        public Color(double newR,
             double newG,
             double newB)
        The explicit constructor. This is the only constructor with any real code in it. Values should be set here, and any variables that need to be calculated should be done here.
        Parameters:
        newR - The new red value.
        newG - The new green value.
        newB - The new blue value.

      • gammaCorrect

        public void gammaCorrect(double gamma)
        Gamma corrents this color.
        Parameters:
        gamma - the gamma value to use (2.2 is generally used).

      • channelAvg

        public double channelAvg()

      • toInt

        public int toInt()
        This function returns an int which represents this color. The standard RGB style bit packing is used and is compatible with java.awt.BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB. (ie - the low 8 bits, 0-7 are for the blue channel, the next 8 are for the green channel, and the next 8 are for the red channel). The highest 8 bits are left untouched.
        Returns:
        An integer representing this color.
